hero.title: Imagine your entire church diving into the digital mission field.
hero.subtitle: A weekend that leads your church to truly evangelize in the digital world.
hero.cta_whatsapp: I want an Immersion in my church

secao2.title_pre: Your church needs more than an
secao2.paragraph_1: You have heard about digital evangelism. Maybe you have even tried to implement something. But a single action, no matter how good, does not transform a church's culture.
secao2.paragraph_2: Immersion exists because we believe the church needs to live the complete experience: first, understand why the digital world is a real mission field. Then be trained with practical tools to act there. And finally, put hands to work, truly evangelizing right there, during that same weekend.
secao2.pull_quote: "The internet is an unreached country. Immersion is the missionary trip there."
secao2.image_alt: The church as a missionary family in the digital world

despertar.title: Awaken
despertar.heading: First, the church needs to see the field.
despertar.text: Immersion starts by breaking paradigms. Through talks, data, real testimonies, and impactful dynamics, the whole church (leaders, youth, parents) is awakened to understand that the digital world is not the enemy: it is a vast mission territory where millions seek meaning and no one is proclaiming Christ.

items.title: Talk: 'Walls and Bridges'
items.description: Confronting the view that technology is a threat and opening eyes to the opportunity.

items.title: Reality Check
items.description: Real data on how much time young people spend connected and its impact.

items.title: The Great Digital Commission
items.description: Understanding that the 'Go' also applies to servers and social networks.

equipar.title: Equip
equipar.heading: Then, each person receives tools.
equipar.text: It is not enough to see the field: you need to know how to cultivate it. We train the church with practical tools: how to evangelize in games, how to turn digital conversations into bridges to Christ, and how parents can shepherd children in the virtual world. Each audience leaves with concrete skills.

items.title: Gamer Workshop
items.description: Young people learn to be missionaries in the games they already play every day.

items.title: Digital Evangelism
items.description: How to start intentional conversations and share the Gospel online.

items.title: Parents Workshop
items.description: Tools to shepherd children's hearts in a hyper-connected world.

acompanhar.title: Follow Through
acompanhar.heading: Finally, the church goes into the field, right there.
acompanhar.text: Immersion does not end in theory. At the culminating moment of the weekend, the whole church is mobilized for a real digital evangelistic action. Phones in hand, faith in heart, and the courage to proclaim Christ to someone who needs to hear. This is where testimonies are born that mark lives forever.

items.title: Discipleship Community
items.description: Support groups and ongoing growth for digital missionaries.

items.title: Mentoring
items.description: Close follow-up to strengthen faith and missionary practice.

items.title: Multiplication
items.description: Forming new leaders to expand the church's reach in digital spaces.

items.text: An isolated project solves one moment. Immersion creates a context: the whole church, from pastor to teenager, living the same experience at the same time. That changes culture, not only schedule.
When awakening, training, and practice happen together and in sequence, results are immediate. The church leaves the weekend with real evangelism stories, not notebook notes.
If you organize mission congresses, youth conferences, or leadership retreats, Immersion fits perfectly as the main program or as a complete module within your event.
